intro: Cryptantha gayi, commonly known as the narrowleaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Cryptantha gayi is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
